subject: RE: [junit] Re: can't catch exception... (more)
msgSnippet: No.  It s starts the runner up in its own thread (see TestRunner.runTest()), but that shouldn t keep you from catching the exception on the outside of the
messageBody:
No. It's starts the runner up in its own thread (see TestRunner.runTest()),
but that shouldn't keep you from catching the exception on the outside of
the call. Try extending ExceptionTestCase and see if you can get the test
to pass with that failure (in junit.extensions).

-Jason

>
>
> Tried that to no avail. Does JUnit do something strange with
> threading?
>
> Thanks,
> Craig
